name: sfchronicle
text:
A woman was arrested and booked for attempted murder after a vehicle drove into protesters in San Jose yesterday, police said. The vehicle ran over two men, then drove toward a crowd of protesters and Santa Clara County deputies.

Read more live updates: https://t.co/YKy1P93oGt

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
A small group of S.F. protesters stood face-to-face with police at 17th Street and Mission Avenue, yelling and taunting, but otherwise remaining peaceful. 

"Say his name! George Floyd," they yelled.

For updates: https://t.co/CDLTM09f5L

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Target said it would temporarily close most of its stores nationwide to protect the safety and health of its workers. Some stores in S.F., Oakland, Berkeley and Emeryville will close. Read the full list: https://t.co/xlKKrxN5qj

text:

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: After a relatively calm start, police in Oakland launched tear gas into the crowd as the protest escalated around 11 p.m. At least one dumpster was set ablaze. For live updates: https://t.co/OYIymvod1R

name: sfchronicle
text:
Due to the damage and looting from Saturday's protests, San Francisco will be under a curfew tonight, from 8 p.m. to 5 a.m., Mayor London Breed said. She said the state’s National Guard will be “on standby” to assist with enforcement.

https://t.co/XVPu39Svwk
